code: @Manual{,   title = {sparseNumeric: Sparse Numeric Vectors with Fast Algebra},   author = {Arjun Kumar},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.1.0},   url = {https://arjunkumar2004.github.io/sparseNumeric/}, }

what: Sparse Numeric Vectors with Fast Algebra
title: Sparse Numeric Vectors with Fast Algebra
text: devtools::install_github(“/sparseNumeric”) load : Example usage Create sparse vector coercing numeric: Writing Coerce back dense want view values: Writing
code: library(sparseNumeric) #>  #> Attaching package: 'sparseNumeric' #> The following object is masked from 'package:base': #>  #>     norm x <- as(c(0, 0, 5, 0, -2), "sparse_numeric") x #> sparse_numeric (length=5, nnz=2) #>   entries: [3]=5, [5]=-2 as(x, "numeric") #> [1]  0  0  5  0 -2

title: Sparse Numeric Vectors with Fast Algebra
code: y <- as(c(1, 1, 0, 0, 4), "sparse_numeric")  sparse_add(x, y) #> sparse_numeric (length=5, nnz=4) #>   entries: [1]=1, [2]=1, [3]=5, [5]=2 sparse_sub(x, y) #> sparse_numeric (length=5, nnz=4) #>   entries: [1]=-1, [2]=-1, [3]=5, [5]=-6 sparse_mult(x, y) #> sparse_numeric (length=5, nnz=1) #>   entries: [5]=-8 x + y #> sparse_numeric (length=5, nnz=4) #>   entries: [1]=1, [2]=1, [3]=5, [5]=2 x - y #> sparse_numeric (length=5, nnz=4) #>   entries: [1]=-1, [2]=-1, [3]=5, [5]=-6 x * y #> sparse_numeric (length=5, nnz=1) #>   entries: [5]=-8

text: standardize() returns sparse vector element (xi​−xˉ)/sx using mean sample standard deviation including implicit zeros. Writing

title: Sparse Numeric Vectors with Fast Algebra
text: plot method compares overlapping nonzero positions: Writing
code: x2 <- as(c(0, 2, 0, 0, 3), "sparse_numeric") y2 <- as(c(0, 5, 0, 0, -1), "sparse_numeric") plot(x2, y2)

title: Sparse Numeric Vectors with Fast Algebra
text: internal representation always keeps positions strictly increasing never stores explicit zeros. operations (like standardization) can increase number stored entries, standardized zeros become nonzero values.
